entry.content:

I move across multiple disciplines with enthusiasm and curiosity, and with pragmatic agility I envision on a strategic level, execute on the tactical level and initiate business activities that drive results.

I’m analytical, intuitive and tech savvy, a generalizing specialist with a strong grasp on business, marketing, technology and education.

entry.title: Employment
entry.content:
“Where your talents and the needs of the world meet; therein lies your vocation.” Aristotle

Program Director (2006 - Present)

University of Calgary Continuing Education

The University of Calgary has one of Canada’s largest and most successful continuing education departments. As Program Director, I oversee all aspects of the IT Programs of Study and with a focus on the financial and academic outcomes, I have built a financially viable unit consisting of a strong instructional team and cross-functional support staff, that create and deliver superior student experiences, providing long-term value for adult learners and the university community.

Key Accomplishments

► New Product Development: Opens markets and achieves growth

Deployed two diploma programs generating $260k net revenue in first six months.

Led a project team to design and develop a ‘Certificate in Business Intelligence’ and a ‘Certificate for Emerging Data Analysts’, the first such programs in Western Canada.

New course in business intelligence generates $25K, highest grossing course ever.

► Product Life-Cycle Management: Maintains and grows existing portfolio

Redesigned programs in Office Applications, Digital Media Design, and Web Design, increasing gross revenue three-fold in just five years.

Program redesign ensures program content is trending, relevant and in demand.

► Business Process Innovation: Increases net revenue twelvefold

Market research and analysis resulted in a 74% reduction in program offerings, significantly improving financial health of entire product line.

Incremental and iterative improvement to business processes significantly reduces operational expense.

Reengineered additional business processes within the unit, resulting in substantial gains in efficiency thus allowing natural staff attrition to reduce team size by more than 50%.

► Change Management Initiative: Propels team from reactivity to proactivity

Initiated and cultivated a process whereby team members began working collaboratively and transparently, building a community of trust and respect.

► Catalyst Driving Technological Change: Improves end user experience

First instructional lab on campus to: use virtualization software for course delivery deliver programs of study simultaneously in class and online use cloud platform technologies to seamlessly deliver technology to customers

► New Business Intelligence Program: Enhances business decision-making

Initiated the first business intelligence program for Continuing Education responsible for the front-end business user reports and data analysis.

entry.title: Education
Recommendations
entry.content:
Mark combines visionary leadership with excellent operational management. He ensures that courses within certificate programs under his leadership provide current, practical, and relevant education to students.

He taps the instructors’ strengths by allowing room for creativity while maintaining high quality of the courses taught.

He is definitely one of the best managers that I ever reported to as an instructor.

Jolanta Warpechowska-Gruca, Instructor. August 31, 2013.

Working with Mark was a pleasure as he exemplified what it meant to work in a truly collaborative nature.

He was very easy to work with and was open and receptive to all ideas that were presented and I believe that his collaborative spirit contributed to what will be a highly successful program.

Chris Sorensen, Instructor. July 19, 2013.

Mark an exceptional hands-on manager. He completely understands the issues his instructors face in the labs and relates to them at their level.

Mark allows his instructors the freedom to do what they do best: design and deliver a course to the best of their abilities and to the maximum benefit of the students.

Because of these reasons, and because of Mark’s good nature, I look forward to working with him for many more years.

Joe Cygman, Instructor. March 21, 2013.
